revision.comment: Omega moved page [[Arietta G25]] to [[Acme Systems Arietta G25]]: fixed ;
revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=Acme Systems |model=Arietta G25 |price=28 |est_release_date=January 2014 |manuf_country=Italy |is_manuf=Yes |availability=Long Term Availability to 2024 |type=single-board computer |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=none (pads) |cpu1_brand=Atmel |cpu1_model=AT91SAM9G25 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |fla1=0 |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4T1G164QF-BIE6 |expansion_if_types=Micro USB, |expansion_usb_num=1 |eth_none=true |addl_chips=EMI Filter for T-Flash /MicroSD Interfaces;ON Semi;CM1624;;1;,,, 4-Pin MicroprocessorPower Supply Supervisor;On Semi;CAT811;;1;,,, 1.7MHz, 1A, Step-Down Converter;ON Semi;NCP1529;;3;,,, |flags=Micro SD Card slot,, UART,, SPI,, I2C,, I2S |stock_boot=U-Boot; |stock_os=Linux; |default_user=root |default_pass=acmesystems }} {{TagLine|Single Board Computer - Arietta G25}} :[https://www.acmesystems.it/arietta Product page] Can also be powered via USB OTG *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/01/19/9-99-euros-arietta-g25-board-features-atmel-sam9g25-arm9-processor/ ''9.99 Euros Arietta G25 Board Features Atmel SAM9G25 (ARM9)
Processor'' on '''CNX|Soft'''] *[http://linuxgizmos.com/tiny-arm9-module-runs-linux/ ''Tiny module runs Linux on ARM9-based Atmel SAM9G25 SoC'' on '''LinuxGizmos'''] *[https://hackaday.com/2014/11/01/arietta-g25-has-us-wondering-where-arm-boards-are-going/ ''Arietta G25 Has Us Wondering Where ARM Boards are Going'' on '''HACKADAY'''] ===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Atmel]]'' AT91SAM9G25 @400MHz ARM ARM926 *RAM: 128MB DDR2 RAM *Storage: MicroSD Card Slot
